intro: Symphysia martinicensis, commonly known as the Martinique symphysia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Martinique. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
